title: OS X makes boring font exciting...
content:
Who said moiré was bad? Nope—it’s fun fun fun!

This font, 79, by—I have no clue—is _just okay_. Not TDC material, I know, but it does have a purpose.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100806234711im_/http:/typophile.com/files/79_6285.png)

But look at what OS X Exposé can do to it.

Groovy gradient patterns within the letters.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100806234711im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture32_3799.png)

Mikey :-)
author: SuperUltraFabulous

comments.content: This is because it was designed to be used at a certain size. On screen and with low resolution, lines start crashing together when the size is to small. (Exposé zooms out even more with its transitions)
